Body: So I have successfully installed a new keyboard and enabled it in settings > keyboard and languages.    I have been able to set it to the default keyboard by doing a long press on an input field and selecting inputmethod... however I need to do this on several devices and its kind of lengthy ... is there a way to set this with a shell command?
Title: Set Default Keyboard without having to long hold text input?

history.Text: So I have successfully installed a new keyboard and enabled it in settings > keyboard and languages.    I have been able to set it to the default keyboard by doing a long press on an input field and selecting inputmethod... however I need to do this on several devices and its kind of lengthy ... 1. is there a way to set this programmatically with adb shell?  2. what would I need to change to compile it into my android build and use it as the default straight out of the box?
Set Default Keyboard without having to long hold text input?

So I have successfully installed a new keyboard and enabled it in settings > keyboard and languages.    I have been able to set it to the default keyboard by doing a long press on an input field and selecting inputmethod... however I need to do this on several devices and its kind of lengthy ... 1. is there a way to set this programmatically with adb shell?  2. (apparently OT.... but feel free to chime in if you happen to know the answer) what would I need to change to compile it into my android build and use it as the default straight out of the box?

So I have successfully installed a new keyboard and enabled it in settings > keyboard and languages.    I have been able to set it to the default keyboard by doing a long press on an input field and selecting inputmethod... however I need to do this on several devices and its kind of lengthy ... is there a way to set this programmatically with adb shell?

history.Comment: Replace mention of `adb shell` with "shell command", since that is what's really asked for.

I have been able to set it to the default keyboard by doing a long press on an input field and selecting inputmethod... however I need to do this on several devices and its kind of lengthy ... is there a way to set this with a shell command?

history.Comment: Replace mention of `adb shell` with "shell command", since that is what's really asked for.
